Gameplay

Class Tower

  • java.lang.Object
    • Gameplay.Tower

  • public class Tower
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int airID
      airID - int storing the value of the air ID.

      damage - int variable storing damage that the tower deals.

      height - int variable storing the height.
      (package private) int mobBeingShot
      mobBeingShot - int storing whehter the mob is being shot or not.

      mobBeingShot3 - int storing whehter the mob is being shot or not.
      (package private) java.awt.Rectangle rangeRec
      rangeRec - Reference variable for rectangle, storing a rectangle which represents the shape of a tower's range.
      (package private) int shootFPS
      shootFPS - int variable storing the shoot frames per second, speed of the game, as shootFrame restarts when the loop hits shootFPS's value.
      (package private) int shootFrame
      shootFrame - int variable storing the first shoot frame.
      (package private) int shootFrame2
      shootFrame - int variable storing the second shoot frame.
      (package private) int shootFrame3
      shootFrame - int variable storing the third shoot frame.
      (package private) boolean shooting
      shooting - boolean storing whether the first ray from a tower is shooting at the moment or not.
      (package private) boolean shooting2
      shooting2 - boolean storing whether the second ray from a tower is shooting at the moment or not.
      (package private) boolean shooting3
      shooting3 - boolean storing whether the third ray from a tower is shooting at the moment or not.
      (package private) int towerRange
      towerRange - int storing the magnitude of the tower's range.
      (package private) int width
      width - int variable storing the width.
      (package private) int x
      x - int variable storing the x position.
      (package private) int y
      y - int variable storing the x position.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tower(int x, int y, int width, int height, int airID)
      This is the constructor, x, y, width, height, airID (type of tower) is passed in and the information is updated within this class.

        boolean shooting
        shooting - boolean storing whether the first ray from a tower is shooting at the moment or not. It is instantiated to false.

        shooting2 - boolean storing whether the second ray from a tower is shooting at the moment or not. It is instantiated to false.

        shooting3 - boolean storing whether the third ray from a tower is shooting at the moment or not. It is instantiated to false.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tower

        public Tower(int x,
             int y,
             int width,
             int height,
             int airID)
        This is the constructor, x, y, width, height, airID (type of tower) is passed in and the information is updated within this class. It will set the correct range and damage of the tower you have selected with your click and drop from the store.
        Parameters:
        x - int, x position of tower.
        y - int, y position of tower.
        width - int, width of tower.
        height - int, height of tower.
        airID - int, type of tower the mouse is holding and about to be clicked and dropped on a tile.

    • Method Detail

      • process

        public void process()
        This method is the physics of the towers, it contains the mechanics of each individual tower dealing damage. Note how BCell has three shooting (shooting2 and shooting3) as it has three rays when it shoots while others only have one. Damage is calculated here!

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method draws the tower (airID of tileset_air) onto the game board.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics reference variable

      • fight

        public void fight(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method contains the fighting physics or mechanics of towers. It displays the ray that the tower is shooting.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics reference variable
